definitions.definition: ( now historical ) A town containing merchants who have exclusive right , under royal authority , to purchase or produce certain goods for export ; also , the body of such merchants seen as a group .
( by extension ) Place of supply; source.
The principal commodity produced in a town or region.

examples: Rice is a staple in the diet of many cultures.

definitions.definition: Short fiber, as of cotton, sheep’s wool , or the like , which can be spun into yarn or thread .

main_definition: ( now historical ) A town containing merchants who have exclusive right , under royal authority , to purchase or produce certain goods for export ; also , the body of such merchants seen as a group .
secondary_definitions: ( by extension ) Place of supply; source.
The principal commodity produced in a town or region.
Short fiber, as of cotton, sheep’s wool , or the like , which can be spun into yarn or thread .

definitions.definition: Any of several types of fastener comprising a bent piece of wire.

subdefinitions.definition: A wire fastener , made of thin wire, used to secure stacks of paper by penetrating all the sheets and curling around.
examples: They stapled the documents with an office stapler, putting a staple in the top left corner of each one.

subdefinitions.definition: A wire fastener, in any of various sizes, used to secure something else by penetrating and curling.
examples: They stapled the housewrap with a staple gun firing large staples .

subdefinitions.definition: A U-shaped wire fastener, made of thick wire, used to attach fence wire or other material to posts or structures.
examples: The rancher used staples to attach the barbed wire to the fence posts.

definitions.definition: One of a set of U-shaped metal rods hammered into a structure, such as a piling or wharf , which serve as a ladder .
examples: Fortunately, there were staples in the quay wall, and she was able to climb out of the water.

definitions.definition: A shaft , smaller and shorter than the principal one, joining different levels .
A district granted to an abbey .

main_definition: Any of several types of fastener comprising a bent piece of wire.
secondary_definitions: One of a set of U-shaped metal rods hammered into a structure, such as a piling or wharf , which serve as a ladder .
( mining ) A shaft , smaller and shorter than the principal one, joining different levels .
A district granted to an abbey .
